history.content: Attendance is not mandatory and the worksheets are posted online along with solutions, so you could always go through them on your own time. The only thing I would say to be aware of is that in order to be eligible for midterm clobbering (having a portion of your final boost one of your midterm scores if you do better on that part), you need to attend a majority of discussions (19 out of 23). At least that is the policy for this semester. Not sure if it will change in the future. Hope this helps!

children.subject:
How important you find discussions to be depends on your style of learning. Personally I felt that the discussions were slowed down by people who hadn't watched lecture (I was guilty of this too a bunch of times lol), so I didn't really get much out of them at all. I'd have preferred to just do the worksheets on my own, but I went anyways for clobbering points (I think our semester you needed 17/23 to clobber, though the number was lowered due to smoke cancellations.)

Also, the final last semester was a good bit harder than either midterm, so I doubt very many people benefited from the clobber at all.

history.content:
Would I probably be okay if I only attended one of the two weekly EE16A discussions? I currently have a time conflict (I already know that we can attend any discussion, but I have conflicts with all of them besides just one day of one section). 

Basically, is attendance mandatory, and/or is discussion vital to doing well in the class?
history.subject: EE16A Discussion
